creator: kita0314
title: Intelligent Glasses Case
materials_required: L298N a dual H-Bridge motor driver
description: The LED Glasses Case helps locate glasses in the dark and can be used as a night lamp. It uses an RGB stripe, ultrasonic sensor, L2N98 driver, and a 12v power supply, controlled by an Arduino Leonardo.
steps: Connect the D-Pins and the 12v RGB strip to the L298N motor driver. Connect the D-pins with "~" like Pin 3, 5, 6 for analogWrite.
Connect the Ultrasonic Sensor to the Arduino Board with Trig to Pin 13 and Echo to Pin 11.
Download and upload the code from the provided link to the Arduino.

Create the glasses case by finding a suitable box, drilling holes for the LED strip and 12v power, and cutting a hole for the ultrasonic sensor. Place the board on top, ensuring the sensor is at least 2cm away from the glasses. Plug in the power.
Plug in the 12v power and the input of the arduino board then it's done.
